p: Various extracts and pure compounds obtained from the plant acted as potential antibacterial and antifungal agents ( 164). In another investigation, leaves and roots of the plant were extracted with methanol, diethyl ether, and n-hexane and assessed for antibacterial potential against S. typhimurium and E. coli using agar plate diffusion assay. The methanol and hexane based extract showed substantial antimicrobial effects. A considerable rise in antibacterial activity of Tibrim was observed on co-administering with methanolic and hexane extracts of the plant ( 165).
